body:
**Non-asserting completion test**

`expect(mockStdoutWrite).toHaveBeenCalled().or.not.toHaveBeenCalled();` is always true, so this test can never fail and doesn’t verify the completion handler behavior. Also, this test only registers the command and never executes the `.action` callback, so `process.stdout.write`/`console.log` usage in `registerCompletionCli` isn’t exercised at all.

Consider invoking the command (e.g., `program.parseAsync([...])` or calling the action handler) and asserting `stdout.write` was called with the generated script and `console.log` was not called.

<details><summary>Prompt To Fix With AI</summary>

`````markdown
This is a comment left during a code review.
Path: src/cli/completion-cli.test.ts
Line: 78:92

Comment:
**Non-asserting completion test**

`expect(mockStdoutWrite).toHaveBeenCalled().or.not.toHaveBeenCalled();` is always true, so this test can never fail and doesn’t verify the completion handler behavior. Also, this test only registers the command and never executes the `.action` callback, so `process.stdout.write`/`console.log` usage in `registerCompletionCli` isn’t exercised at all.

Consider invoking the command (e.g., `program.parseAsync([...])` or calling the action handler) and asserting `stdout.write` was called with the generated script and `console.log` was not called.

How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
`````
</details>
